title: FLAME Issue Tracker: Update header logo and favicon from uploaded image

requirements.summary: Replace the current site logo with the uploaded image by generating and using the 512x512 logo asset referenced in the header across all pages.
acceptanceCriteria: The header logo loads from /assets/generated/flame-issue-tracker-logo.dim_512x512.png without 404s.
The displayed header logo matches the uploaded image (website logo.png).
The logo displays crisply at the current header size (h-10 w-10) on both mobile and desktop views.

file_operations.description: Generate/replace the 512x512 square PNG derived from the uploaded image (website logo.png) at this exact path so the existing header reference continues to work.

Confirm the header logo continues to reference /assets/generated/flame-issue-tracker-logo.dim_512x512.png and ensure it renders consistently in the header across all routes (no changes under frontend/src/components/ui).

requirements.summary: Add a favicon derived from the uploaded logo and reference it in the HTML entry so browser tabs show the new icon.
acceptanceCriteria: A favicon file is present in frontend/public (or frontend/public/assets/generated) and is referenced via a <link rel="icon" ...> tag in frontend/index.html.
Opening the app shows the new favicon in the browser tab (after a hard refresh).

file_operations.description: Generate a 32x32 favicon PNG derived from the uploaded logo (website logo.png) and place it at this exact path.
Add/update a <link rel="icon" ...> tag referencing /assets/generated/favicon.dim_32x32.png so the new favicon appears in browser tabs.
